Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandET
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. The receptionist is very friendly & helpful, WIFI is for free and works very well, the room is typicall french and nice but the bathroom is AWESOME for a three star hotel! Location is great, couldn't be better - a short and nce walk to Notre Dame, Seine and a 20 min walk to the Louvre, 45 min walk to Champs Elyssees. The area is great with plenty of bars, places to just "hang out" and eat! I would defin. go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near the Marais”
Reviews.Author: chatelaine76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg recently, as part of a weekend getaway. The personnel on the front desk were lovely, as were the chambermaids. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - it seemed a shame to do so when we were able to explore the Marais and have breakfast on the terraces of nearby cafes and watch the world go by. The room was compact - not small, as such but certainly not spacious. The bed was comfortable and it all felt quite cozy. Lots of storage space between the chest of drawers and the wardrobe. The mirror in our wardrobe had a slight crack in it. The bathroom was immaculately clean but had a low ceiling. I'm 5' 10" so I can imagine showering being uncomfortable for anyone over 6' in height! The toiletries were a citrus-scented hair and body wash - bring your own is my advice. All in all, good value for money and a great place to base yourself if you are hanging out in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beauborg Delivered”
Reviews.Author: rarSeattle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotle Beauborg numerous times over several years. i have always found the hotel met my needs i.e. clean and quiet rooms with an efficient check in and check out. This stay my room was on the 5th floor. The elevator only goes to the 4th floor so I had to carry my bags up one flight. The elevator shaft was right outside my room and everytime the elevator was in use I could hear an annoying thump as the elevator engaged. This was not a problem at night but early in the morning it was heard continually as people checked out. I would stay here again but not the room on the 5th floor. The ceiling was slanted so I could not stand up straight in the majority of the room. And I am not tall.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Footloose01
Reviews.Content: Cosy traditional Paris hotel, fantastic location in the heart of the Marais, comfortable room with a recently-refurbished bathroom, quiet, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days in this hotel in February 2012. We were very pleased with the experience. The room was very clean. The bathroom in the room we occupied looked as if it had been recently renovated, it was very modern with a bath tub with a shower head. The hotel is very convenient to either the Hotel de Ville (1 line) Metro or a closer metro on the eleven (11) line. The hotel is extremely close to the Pompidou center so there are lots of restaurants in the area. It is very close to a couple of small grocery stores and some pastry shops. We ate breakfast in the hotel a couple of days, but found it be much less expensive to eat at the local pastry shops and I liked the pastry shop food better. Breakfast was essentially three kinds of bread. There was some cereal that looked like it had never been touched and for extra money you could get protein of some sort. We paid 130 Euros per night. There are a few homeless in the area, they were alcoholics and never appeared threatening. Later in the week we transferred to another "modern" hotel near the convention center for a meeting, I like the Beauborg much better because you feel like you have experienced France.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Mica1966
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel in the best area of Paris, rooms are very nice and toilet very nice and clean. The only remark is that the hotel has wiifi free but signal is to weak so sometimes it takes time and TV only in french!! location is great 1 minute from metro station in fornt of Pompidou center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Fresh, Charming, QUIET plus great location!”
Reviews.Author: Daina R
Reviews.Content: As a designer, I have a discerning eye for aesthetics and this place was charming thru and thru. From the hours I spent searching there are a lot of duds out there and I'm glad I finally found and booked this one and wasn't disappointed with my choice! Friendly staff, speaks English, and great with helping you plan- I emailed back and forth several times with them on arranging the details of the stay. I had the twin double room. Room was clean, charming, and renovated bathroom with a shower and tub with great water pressure. There was plenty of space and a storage closet and we were quite comfortable and had a place for our stuff. The neighborhood is cute with lots of cafes, shops, and restaurants and very close to tourist attractions, but w/o feeling like your in a tourist only zone. We stayed in Feb and it was very cold but our room was always toasty and quiet! Comfortable beds and bedding / sheets. At breakfast they give you your personal pot of cafe ole! The breakfast is a typical light French style with french bread, croissants, butter, jam, orange juice, and coffee. There is also cereal and for a little extra you can add a egg or sausage. The wifi is a little slow at times and you have to login each time you use the wifi, but once I got the hang of the process I was able to get it working faster. Only one day it barely worked at all. You have to first make sure you are connected to the right network, then open a new browser window and wait for the right user / pass field to put in and make sure to hit the start browsing button, and not to close that window. If you close your computer, you have to do the process all over again. It was good enough to send the family photos everyday via picasa.

Reviews.Title: “great place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: mandy m
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet about many places to stay in Paris, I finally found Hotel Beaubourg and the reviews all seemed to be pleasant. At first I only made a reservation for the 1st half of our trip and we ended up extending the room for the entire 13 days. Rooms were cozy with more than enough space for our two suitcases. Everything was kept very clean and each staff member was super friendly and very helpful. This hotel is in an awesome neighborhood with shops, food, metro stop, and sights right there yet the room was still very quiet. I would return and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to enjoy a mellow or exciting trip.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: patricia m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated in the heart of Paris, with public transport close by. Once you enter the hotel it is very quiet, in sharp contrast with the bustle outside. The room was very pleasant, the atmosphere refined and the bathroom comfortable. There was no noise at night. Breakfast was plentiful and was served in unusual surroundings, a really ancient stone vaulted room. The staff is pleasant and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelCleveland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location within walking distance to many tourist attractions including Notre Dame, the Seine River, Centre Pompidou and is close to the subway. It is also in the middle of a gay district so there are many gay bars and restaraunts within a short walking distance as well. We did get some misleading advise from the front desk. We were told the Eiffel Tower was a short walk away. It took us almost an hour to walk there by foot. Ultimately, we should have taken a river boat on the Seine River to the Eiffel Tower. We also were given wrong directions by the front desk to get to a museum and found it to be very frustrating. Fortunately, everyone we met in Paris was very friendly and helpful so we were able to find our way. Other than those two situations our stay at this hotel was great. The front desk staff were always friendly and tried to give us useful information. Our room was very quiet and surprisingly very spacious. The room was decorated with a French flair and it was kept very clean. The rooms have upholstered walls which were kind of cool. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “fab location .. if your heading out alot.”
Reviews.Author: pelican23
Reviews.Content: My daughhter was the one who stayed and she wrote :-- I went to this hotel for my 21st birthday. I wanted it to be really special and wanted to be somewhere that was very central. I found the hotel very reasonable in price and the staff spoke very good english and were very helpful. I felt like they really looked after us. It was very clean. There were a few issues though, a few of the plugs in our room didn't work and The room was also very dark, so it didn't help that we then couldnt use all the lamps. I am used to a very hard bed but their's were extremely hard. If you are heading to Paris to see the sights and take in the lifestyle and are planning to be out a quite a bit then this hotel is a great place to crash. With metro stations and train stations with in 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: wmnej
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg for 4 nights in a room overlooking the back courtyard. Simple, clean room with surprisingly larger than expected bathroom. Friendly and helpful lobby staff. Number one plus was the location -- it was so central to get to everywhere we wanted to go, whether it be walking or taking Metro. I cannot comment on the breakfast as we did not partake. Wifi worked fine too, not always perfect but more than adequate. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DaisyandDex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg for two nights with another the couple. The staff was always helpful and the rooms are clean and neat. Location is really convenient, though not a picturesque street, it's right on the doorstep of the more stylish streets in the Marais and an easy walk to the Louvre and other areas of interest. The free Wifi, was an added bonus and easy to get onto.

Reviews.Title: “For Paris Price/Value balance is good”
Reviews.Author: markoroman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is easy to find, centrally located, close to metro station and in the beautiful marais area with lots of shops, restaurants, bars, ... . The room size is ok for Paris (small hotel rooms are very common). The bathroom was rather large for Paris and quite new. I did not book breakfast so I cant say. My room was to the backyeard so rather quiet. As usual in Paris u can hear ur room neighbours a bit. Room looked okay but not stylish or anything. Bed was good as was matress and everything was cleasn. Staff had been changing quite often but always friendly at the reservation desk. By handing out the keys when one returns to the hotel I think they should ask for the name as well and check, cause some of the staff i saw the first time. Last remark: Cleaning / Room Service came in twice in my room without knocking or checking whether I was in my room. I think that shouldnt happen and it is no big effort to knock on the door before you be invized to enter.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: big-bill3
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its star rating and its location, which is very good for the Marais and for the Islands. The room was not large but clean and well appointed. The Shower was good and large enough for the two of us. At €9.50 each the breakfast was rather expensive for a simple continental fare (coffee, Croissant, Pain au Chocolat, Cornflakes, Yoghurt)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: John311
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean, with courteous staff and I can’t say enough about its location. It’s a 3 star in central Paris so it’s not cheap and don’t expect space or too many amenities. The room is really small but when in Paris you really don’t stay in too much. Good French breakfast in a cozy underground room (you have to pay) and free Wi-Fi. The location is excellent, a couple blocks from Notre Dame and close to cafes and shops plus if you like to walk, the Louvre and Champs-Elysees aren’t that far away. Next time in Paris, will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is an acceptable 3 star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: schnoodleontheroad
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but the Beaubourg was quite acceptable. It is in a great location on the edge of the Marais, just across the street from the Pompidou Centre. It is about a 4 minute walk to Chatelet - Les Halles, which is a good metro hub, but also has an RER stop for the trains to and from both Orly Airport and Charles de Gaulle Airport ( It took about 55 minutes to get to the hotel from Orly and about 35 minutes to get from the hotel to CDG when I left). TIP: If taking the RER to CDG airport, choose the right train for the terminal that you need to go to. The trains leave from the same track and are well marked as to which terminals they go to, but there are some that go only to Terminals 1 and 3 and others (TGV) that go only to Terminal 2. If you choose the right train at Chatelets, you won't have to locate and take the shuttle between terminals - which will add time to your trip. The hotel is small, the room was European small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. The window overlooked a small courtyard so it was very quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly. About 1 minute after I checked in the power went out for about a minute. When I asked they said that someone was doing some work on the facilities and they had to switch the electricity off for brief periods. And in the morning, at about 8 am, there was some noise from the room next door as they were tearing up the carpet. Other than these little issues, the hotel was quite acceptable, although on a return trip, I might consider the Petit Moulin Hotel which is closeby and a bit more upscale (with a bit higher price of course), but the Beaubourg was quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beauborg”
Reviews.Author: Clive131
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Beauborg for four nights. Having read previous reviews we asked for and got a room overlooking the courtyard and it was lovely and quiet. The rooms are small but adequate and the one we were in was nicely decorated. We had a twin bed room and for me the bed was very comfortable. A larger room would be nice but overall a positive experience. However, a few small points. The free much appreciated wifi needs to be improved as the signal drops constantly and this is very annoying. What is really below par however is the quality of the toiletries. At a rate of an average €150 a night we would expect something a bit better than the thin sachets. Surely a decent bar of soap etc would not be too much to ask. I think this really lets down the quality of the hotel and gives the appearance of meaness.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location, rooms VERY small”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFinns
Reviews.Content: Good choice, but rooms are extremely small compared to price what you pay, also breakfast was extra

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiricol
Reviews.Content: We keep going back, year after year. The staff is friendly, the room is lovely, the location right next door to the Pompidou center and close to restaurants and jazz clubs ... what more could we want?!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good and an excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTocino
Reviews.Content: We have probably stayed at the Beaubourg ten times and we continue to sing its praises. For the price you can't do much better. The rooms are charming, comfortable, and clean. The staff (most have been there for the last decade) is helpful and friendly. The wi-fi service is free and reliable. The rooms are kept up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KaitD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Paris and the Hotel Beaubourg made our trip comfortable and pleasurable. At first I was a little skeptical because of the location, down the little Rue Simon Le-Franc side street, across from the Pompidou Center, but I quickly realized the neighborhood had a lot to offer. There were tons of Bars and Restaurants close by in any direction and it was perfect for taking public transit just about anywhere because it is a 5 min walk to the Les Halle metro station. The hotel was inviting and our room was cozy and perfectly decorated. From the exposed beams on the ceiling to the fabric on the walls it was the cute French hotel you would picture in a movie. Coming from NYC I had no problem with the size of the room, and actually the bathroom was very large. Beware of the shower though, you tend to splash out a lot and make a soggy mess of your foot towel, but just adjust the pressure when soaping up and you should be fine. The bed was very comfortable (it was one of those memory foam mattresses which I now understand are amazing and will be purchasing for my home). The room also had a mini bar a large closet, medium flat screen TV, desk and sitting chair. Bathroom amenities (shampoo, body wash, etc) left something to be desired but I bring my own anyway so it didn't matter. Our room faced Rue Simon Le-Franc and was very quiet. We did not try the breakfast menu in the hotel restaurant because we loved our morning trips to the bakery. All in all we had a great stay and look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Always a favorite”
Reviews.Author: Ed P
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this hotel for the last ten years. Consistently good.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hotel Beaubourg again!”
Reviews.Author: stdive
Reviews.Content: Great location right across from the Center Pompidou. Easy access to sites & the metro. Plenty of restaurants, bars & shopping within a 2 minute walk. Staff was very friendly & helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions, and making arrangements for transport to the airport. Our room had a king size bed and very little additional room, but it was very clean, the bed was comfortable & the bathroom was nice. Breakfast was very good and reasonably priced based on everything else in the area. Wi-fi was free and easy to connect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JMBKMB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in an ideal place for transport routes and sightseeing. There are a large number it bars and restaurants all within a 5 minute walk. It felt safe to walk about after dark. The hotel had freindly and welcoming staff and the room was the quietest hotel room we've ever stayed in. Breakfast was simple continental but was very tasty and had a few extras that could be purchased. If i ever have to stay in Paris again i will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: ktmuck
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here recently. It's in a fantastic location right opposite the Pompidou centre. Only complaint would be that we got room 51 which is the top floor, so the ceiling slants over half of the room. I hit my head a few times, which was due to my own clumsiness really. I would suggest asking for another room if you are tall like me. Besides that, I would definitely recommend Hotel Beaubourg.

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: pollyr r
Reviews.Content: lovely little hote, have stayed 4 times, the rooms are small and the hotel itself is small, but I come back because although small they are nicely decorated and it fantastic location, the street it is on though has gone down hill and was not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: HanneFjell
Reviews.Content: Friendly and very helpfull staff. Service 24/7. Perfet located close to the Notre-Dame church. Close to a lot of restaurants. Located near the metro, which makes it easy to travel around in Paris. Cozy rooms in old Paris (french) style.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ubin1234
Reviews.Content: Very nice, nice location, good ratio price/quality, nice hotel, nice staff, clean, internet... I am traveling every week in Europe. I stayed at Hotel Beaubourg as my usual hotels were fully booked, and I have been nicely surprised. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay”
Reviews.Author: bettyb25
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a night at this hotel, very quaint, very clean, a lovely boutique hotel, excellent location and good service. My only query was that I travelled with a colleague, we both booked online directly but for same grade of room and I paid 20 euros more, I cant understand why this would be. Before booking I would suggest that you call the hotel to understand best rates.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sophiebambam
Reviews.Content: Paris is expensive! I was shocked that anything half decent (ie 3 stars) in the Marais was this much money, but their prices were in line with other similar hotels in the area. The Hotel Beaubourg is perfectly situated, and very clean. It is a standard 3 star hotel, just 28 rooms, so small and intimate. No extra luxuries, but felt cosy and comfortable. The front of house staff were all friendly, especially if I made an effort to speak french! One criticism is there were no english tv channels in the room. CNN or BBC World News would have been nice. Also, you sometimes hear a bit of noise from the hall or the room next door. Bathroom was great, with a full bath and spotlessly clean. No frills, but comfortable and convenient. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! There is a Thief among them!”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Think twice before booking this hotel! We celebrated our 2nd anniversary with a trip to Europe, four nights in London then four nights in Paris. We booked this hotel because of their rating on Tripadvisor and the central location to sites we wanted to take in. The Hotel staff were very friendly and the room was decent. We paid 150 Euro per night for a King bed. A little too much noise late at night but not too bad. After we checked out and were on our way back to London for the flight home, I tried to use the Oyster card that was in a card sleeve that I had purchased earlier in London and it did not work. Upon opening the sleeve to look at the card, it had been replaced with a used international calling card. I used this card at the last station at Tower Hill to get to St, Pancreas station to take the Euro Train to Paris. It was in a zippered pocket the entire time. I had two jackets with me so I left this one in the room in Paris because I would not need it again until our return trip to London to get to Victoria station for the express back to Gatwick Airport. The oyster card can be turned back in to get the 5 British Pound deposit plus any amount up to 7 British pound unused on the oyster card. The Oyster card was definitely removed from its sleeve and replaced with the used Calling card in the room at Hotel Beaubourg. It is a minor theft but still a theft. We checked all of our valuables on a daily basis there. The cars sleeve is closed with the card on the inside and you cannot physically see it from the outside but can only feel that it is there.My wife contacted them, gave them this same information. We only asked to be reimbursed for the value of the Oyster card and the amount that was left on it. A total of 9.90 British pounds. They are asking us to fill out a police report to give to their insurance. We inquire how do we go about doing that. Their reply is to "Fill out a Police report". We feel that this is getting us nowhere so We just wanted to let potential victims to be vary careful with this Hotel Beaubourg. Do not leave anything valuable in the room as minor as An Oyster card or Metro cards. It is the principal of the matter not the amount. All they needed to do to make it right with use is to credit my account the 9.90 British Pounds, but I have to spend major time and effort because someone on their staff is a THIEF!

Reviews.Title: “To recomment, perfect location, quit”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Pompidou, Louvre, Marais and easy access to numerous metro stations. Rooms to the backyard are very quit. Can recomment this hotel in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: skipnatl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Beaubourg for 4 nights with my partner. Arrived very early, but front desk offered to store our bags for a few hours until room was ready. Room itself was small (but good size for Paris) and cute in a French sort of way. Bed was quite comfortable, and there were extra pillows available. I requested a courtyard view so I could leave the window open, and it was very quiet. I loved the fabric wall paper. The bathroom was, well, very small and probably the only blemish for the stay. I could not stand up in the shower (I'm 5'11") and at the conclusion of each shower I would need to spend 5 minutes cleaning up water that splashed about the room. There was a small door stop right where you step out of the shower, perfectly located to injure your foot. The breakfast was fine to get you going each morning... nothing special, but the lady working the room was so very nice. You can not beat the location of this hotel. Minutes to the river, minutes to the Ile d'Cite, minutes to the Metro, minutes to anything really. I love the Marais and you are in the center of it. Will I stay here again? Absolutely! Would I recommend it? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Always our choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dbgatlanta
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Pompidou, Louvre, Marais and easy access to numerous metro stations. Staff always professional and helpful. Great restaurants and shopping in Marais. Rooms are always very clean and well decorated, beds comfortable. Also has an elevator if you have any mobility issues. We love this hotel and it's great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rventi1
Reviews.Content: Friends stayed before and this time, my first time - room was clean, good size, excellent shower and up to date. Front Desk staff courteous and checkin/out effortless. Train stop one block up at the entrance to Pompideau. So many good restaurants and cafes seconds away.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: schwaja
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and will continue to stay here every year when we come to Paris. The location is fantastic, the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Handy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ellen D
Reviews.Content: I needed better instructions to find the hotel but once there it was excellent. I loved my 'penthouse' attic room but it wouldn't have been much fun for someone who is tall, however, I am sure the staff would use their discretion and not put a very tall person in the room. The cafe for breakfast was most interesting with its old well shaft in one corner and the food very good. The decor throughout the hotel is intriguing and quite beautiful. The staff were most helpful in every way. My one criticism would be that there was a need for a more defined laundry service for traveller's like me. The staff were willing to help out here but needed more time than is usually available for short stop tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tina K
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a week and were so happy to have stayed at the Beaubourg. The location was very central to many of the sites we wanted to visit, with easy access to the subway and buses. Our hotel room was quiet and clean with comfortable beds and pillows and we found the staff to be very nice, and helpful when we asked for assistance. One morning we were a little late getting down to breakfast and there were no more croissants. The young man in charge offered to go and get us some from the local bakery. He returned in no time with two warm croissants! The area also has a variety of shops, cafes, bakeries and pastry shops. We will certainly return to the Beaubourg on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie2424
Reviews.Content: Location, service, staff is great. A very neat hotel very close to where it´s happening. Members of staff were sweet, helpful und friendly. We can recommend it wholeheartedly and will certainly come back. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MoandKer
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris in 30 years and the first for my husband. When we arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am, we were jet-lagged and tired and as expected, our room wasn't ready for us yet. We offered to leave our bags and check back later, but the staff were very kind and insisted they could move us to another room. Within 5 minutes, we were checked in and in a room. Our room was small, but comfortable and quiet and the bathroom and shower were nice. We stayed here for four nights and throughout our stay, the staff was very helpful with all of our questions and advice on nearby restaurants. The hotel location was great, within walking distance of the Pompidou center, Notre Dame Cathedra, Hotel de Ville and many other sites and with 2 subway stations close by for access to all of Paris and surrounding area. Breakfasts were pretty typical of what we found in most of the French hotels that we stayed in, with fresh rolls & croissants, cereals, yogurt, a little cheese, and coffee & tea. All in all, we were very happy with our stay here and feel it provided good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and, for Paris, a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: HowardFreeland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Beaubourg. We have been to Paris several times before and wanted this time to stay in the Le Marais area. The Pompidou Centre is steps away, Hotel de Ville and Notre Dame very close. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was very quiet and comfortable, the breakfast is in an interesting cave-like area underground, but the breakfast was only adequate. One does pay more for hotels in Paris, but this one was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This was the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: buttondeb
Reviews.Content: A very satisfying location in the Marais, you could almost reach out and touch the Pompidou, and so close to so many sights, stores and interesting streets. A block away from the metro, 5 min walk to Hotel de Ville or Les Halles, and many good restaurants within a 10 min walk, hard to beat the price and location. Do suggest reserving a room well in advance to secure a room in the back away from the street, for example room 17, 27, 37,47 are all surprisingly quiet. The bathrooms have been nicely remodeled and some have a bathtub. Monsieur Kise (sp?), front desk manager, went out of his way to be helpful making suggestions, dinner reservations etc. trying to keep the clientel happy. Some of the evening staff were lacking people skills however. The maids were pleasant and hard working. The air condition was welcomed with the current heat wave in Paris. Only suggestion would be to provide a larger trash can in the room, I've never seen one as small as they have. And agree with others that more light is needed in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: CAlexandra06
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Beaubourg. The hotel is very unique and perfect for a young couple like us visiting Paris for the first time. We booked the very last room in the hotel for the nights we stayed, and it was quite fine. Some of the other rooms looked more handsome, and I expected that the last hotel room to be booked might not be the most special. But really, it was just fine. Small, but clean and with character. We are from Philadelphia, and it was helpful that the staff spoke English well. They kept wine for sale (11euro) at the front desk, which came in handy one night. The hallways are quite narrow, but for me this just adds to the charm. There is a beautiful breakfast room. The location is unbeatable, right next to the Pompidou Center in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for the slippery shower floor”
Reviews.Author: John828
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel previously and rebooked it because of its excellent location and good value. The hotel is clean and the personnel are pleasant and helpful. The building is old and the elevator is small and slow. In their efforts to be eco-conscious the management has diminished the lighting in bedrooms and hallways. They have also provided liquid body wash in the shower in a container that is clumsy to use and miserly. The ceramic bathtub has a high side, no anti-skid material on the floor, and no grab bars.. This makes it difficult to enter and exit and treacherous when wet and soapy. One must be very cautious to avoid a fall. I wasn't cautious enough and did fall in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beaubourg”
Reviews.Author: mizbani
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Hotel Beaubourg because the reviews on Trip Advisor were so positive - it was a good choice. The hotel is lovely and in a perfect location in Paris, near the Marais, Notre Dame, a great central location to walk from and on a quiet street. The hotel upgraded us to room #4, a double room with a private terrace, a delightful room at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time at Hotel Beaubourg”
Reviews.Author: LA-CATraveller
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris four times now and I've stayed at hotel Beaubourg a total of 3 times. During my first visit, I stayed at another hotel which was much more expensive and probably about 75% less space. Hotel Beaubourg is terrific for many reasons, including: 1. Fantastic staff 2. Amazing location 3. Spacious rooms for the Marias and Paris 4. Very clean rooms i love Paris and when I return there is no doubt that I'll be staying at the Hotel Beaubourg again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AustraFrench
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a very busy period in Paris when there was a serious lack of room availability. I got the downstairs basement room, which did have an odour (not unpleasant exactly, but still noticable) but it was spotlessly clean. Also, given the hotel was full it was extremely quiet which is important to me. Free Wi-Fi much appreciated as was help with baggage storage and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Randy C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights and completely enjoyed the hotel. The accomodations are good value for money and the location is unbeatable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful as well. We stayed in room 41, which faces the street, but the double paned windows sealed out what little street noise there was and we had a very restful stay. I highly recommend this hotel and we'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Azmi M
Reviews.Content: Small boutique sized hotel. You get what you pay for. Nicely renovated bathrooms. The room could be a bit more comfortable. I would stay here again. The location is great.: the Pompidou Center is just a metres away. On reaching Rue Beaubourg and looking leftwards and you can see Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Sparklingly clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: suethack
Reviews.Content: We really liked this nice hotel. It is so near to Pompidou Centre and a short walk to Notre Dame. The check out time is MIDDAY! Hooray! The rooms are lovely with en suite baths and showers (we stayed twice). Hotel Beaubourg had a tranquillity about it and it was very quiet even though we were in a central place. There is a fridge but no tea / coffee making facilities. The hotelier was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here for a third time!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this charming hotel in such a fantastic area of Paris"”
Reviews.Author: LDAHL6
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be better situated in the heart of Rambeatu in the Marais area, right be the Pompedou and lots of amazing streets around it with restaurants, cafe's, shops and parks. The staff were very friendly and the room was great. We had the attic room which has beams in it and if you're tall probably not great for you. Breakfast (not included in price) was fresh and in the restored cellar and went on until 11am which was great. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A classy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brune8
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel about 6 years ago and have stayed there since every year when we go to Paris. It's spotless, it's very central to everything, it's reasonable price wise, and the staff have always been courteous and helpful. More than anything, this is ia comfortable and reliable hotel, and has always been perfect for our needs as tourists. Over the last 12 years we have stayed in 7 hotels in Paris, and since we found this, it is the one we return to. The hotel is 3 stars, so it's not huge and things in it are on a 3 star scale, but this is a very good 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Brad G
Reviews.Content: Very efficient place, in the shadow of George Pompidou's museum, we had a nice room, with AC and nice bathroom. Felt safe and had great access to the city. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at beauborg”
Reviews.Author: RobTasmania
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel even though the rooms are small but so is the hotel. It is the quaintness that is appealing Good service at the desk and free wi fi during your stay We love the Marias distict so this hotel is very convenient Also we are able to walk to Notre Dame and the Louvre very short walk to the metro and right across the road from George Pompidou Centre It is a three star hotel with good staff and friendly service We will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AJM1227
Reviews.Content: lovely spot! big bathroom, helpful staff, a little noisy on the street side. people next door to us were chain smoking and we could smell it through the room even though there were signs stating no smoking everywhere. That was the only issue, and overall it was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the second time we have stayed at Hotel Beaubourg. This time we bought our family with us!”
Reviews.Author: michelle b
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great price. Friendly service. Clean and spacious rooms. What more could you ask for in the heart of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Explorer100
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, quiet room, healthy breakfast. Within 5 minutes walking to laundromat (bring own soap), ATM, grocery store, Travelex, Leroy Merlin (AA batteries and 1-to-3 plug converter), Metro station and Pompidou Center (no line to purchase Paris Museum Pass).

Reviews.Title: “would come back”
Reviews.Author: scuba1bear
Reviews.Content: Good location for La Marais--had an "interior room" over looking a "courtyard" but appreciated the quiet. Room was a decent size, clean and comfortable enough. If you want turn down service and chocolates on your pillow, go elsewhere. Breakfast was ok, but there are many cafes nearby for that --and killer croissant if you know where to look.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awful customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Bronchan
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here several times over the last few years, I booked this hotel for the first 2 nights of my honeymoon last week. The hotel itself is lovely, in a great location and the room still did not disappoint, (though having no tea/ coffee making facilities/ free water as well as no bathroom products lets it down slightly). On our first morning however, we were woken up very early by loud banging and scraping from the room upstairs which made it impossible to sleep. After a couple of hours, I went upstairs to have a look and saw the room was being redecorated. I asked at the front desk about this and was truly shocked by the rudeness of the lady on reception. In my broken French and her broken English I came to understand that the guests had flooded the room upstairs. However, there was no apology and was instead told "donq!" I completely understand that a situation like that is out of their control, but having paid 125 euro for a room, I would expect to be able to sleep in after 6.30am or at the very least get an apology when I couldn't. We stay here every year, but may look elsewhere for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahBen41
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Beauborg in Paris and would stay again in future. The room was lovely and the hotel was in a great location, just a short walk to the banks of the Seine and the Ile de La Cite.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place and a GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: lmsclimbs
Reviews.Content: Clean room with modern plumbing, newly redecorated. Lovely breakfast downstairs. Fantastic location by the Pompidou Centre, minutes to everything. Will never stay any where else in Paris. Great value when you book online.

Reviews.Title: “The two of us enjoyed the room and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Lightkl11
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel and friendly staff. Better than most small hotels in europe. Easy to get to metro and short walking distance to Notre Dame. Cute breakfast area, but chose to eat at other cafe's while walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: lbaker6495
Reviews.Content: We had a charming room at Hotel Beaubourg. Very clean with comfortable furnishings. The neighborhood was peaceful and quiet , which was great after a long day of sightseeing. The staff were always helpful and professional. It is conveniently located near Notre Dame, with several cafes nearby serving delicious pastries and quiche. City Metro trains (and city buses) are within easy reach as well, which made traveling between museums and other attractions much more pleasant. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: thcobs
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet small street next to centre Pompidou, next metro station is in 3 minutes walking distance; good, clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JaneQSmith
Reviews.Content: Quite nice. Very clean, and our room was very quiet (we were facing the courtyard). Staff all spoke English, although not completely fluently. I would stay here again; convenient to Metro, Pompidou, Notre Dame and quite a long way from the Eiffel. Lots of restaurants nearby, but we didn't find anything spectacular. There's a small market on the next street east (parallel to the street the Pompidou is on). Seemed like a decent value for what we got, considering how pricey the Paris hotels are. No views from our room, but I think we would have had to pay double for that somewhere else. No in-room safe, so make sure you know the hours you have access to your valuables (something like 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.).

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I stay at when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mykonosteve
Reviews.Content: Great location with extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms in terrific location-definitely will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: APKinney
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - close to many restaurants, shopping, sights, and the metro. The rooms are beautifully decorated, bathrooms are pristine, very clean and comfy beds. Most of the rooms are a good size for Europe (I peeked at a few when the maids were cleaning) but they do have a few of the tiny rooms. I called 2 days before our trip and was told we would have a tiny room so I knew what to expect. But, Klas was very nice to us and was able to offer us the 5th floor room which is spacious but the roof is slanted on part of the room. We liked the privacy of it, only room up there. Then, we had a more spacious room on our trip back from Brussels. The staff is very nice and helpful. We felt very safe there even to leave our computer in the room. The Free wifi is great and we could use it for our computer and iPad. Every morning we went to one of the 4 pastry shops on the block. There are 2 grocery stores for buying cold drinks and snacks. They have a refrigerator in the room. They can even arrange an airport shuttle for you, and have a storage room for your bags until you leave. My only criticism would be to provide some ice but that's hard to find in Europe. It was our first time in Paris and we love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but charming with an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Moi_Lyon
Reviews.Content: I initially chose this location because, having lived in the area before, I know you won't find a much better quartier in Paris than Le Marais. The hotel, right in the centre of Paris, is perfectly situated for sightseeing, but isn't noisy as it's on a tiny side street. The hotel is small and quite basic but I found it very lovely all the same. It wasn't the most modern interior, with heavy flower patterned walls, but it was very romantic and perfect for a couple on a weekend getaway. It is not the kind of hotel you spend a lot of time in as there wasn't any room service or amenities, but it's a lovely place to come home to and have some time alone together after a long day of sightseeing and fine dining. It is also great value, and we paid little given the brilliant location for a busy time of year (a predictable day in February..)

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: MIKED88
Reviews.Content: Good location, price is kinda reasonable for the area. Very nice bathroom, eventhough the room it self was a little old fashioned. The drinks in mini bar were surprisingly not expensive too. I think it's worth trying. Room and bathroom were very clean and nice, not noisy. The major issue for me was the people at the front desk : Grumpy, unfriendly, cold, even agressive... I saw three different people on that desk, they were all very unfriendly. If i was the manager I'd change the staff! Beside that a free bottle of water would have been a plus.

Reviews.Title: “nice little place in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: gridley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect little place in le Marais on a very quiet side street. It's a short street and our cabbie had a little trouble finding it, but they all have gps now so we got there. We had chambre #2 and our friends had chambre #4. Chambre #4 has its own secluded patio with table and chairs. We all sat out there several mornings for coffee and breakfast obtained from a nearby shop. The rooms are a little bland and could use some sprucing up, but they were very clean, had their own bathrooms with showers, spacious for Paris, and comfortable. If you're in the mood for some wine late in the evening (or any time), they sell inexpensive bottles at the front desk and will provide a wine opener. We did not try the breakfast there so no comments on that. The location is unbeatable if you want to be in the marais. The hotel is gay-friendly - we were 2 gay couples - and close to the marais bars and cafes. The front desk people were courteous and helpful. All spoke English and didn't seem to mind our attempts to speak a few French phrases. There's a closet to store your bags if you need to check out before you're ready to leave. They will call cabs for you and also are willing to make recommendations for restaurants and things to do. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2011. The room was very pleasant with a refrigerator That was very convienient. We liked the location across from the Pompadeaux Center. We also liked that it was an easy walk to the Marias area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cute and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Orijit
Reviews.Content: Great location. Bus 38 runs through the heart of the city and drops you right in front of the hotels. LOTS of not-too-expensive restaurants and bars everywhere. Walking distance to loads of sights. Amazing location. The rooms were thematically done. Very nice. Friedly staff. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel convenient to all of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DB305
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Hotel Beaubourg. I chose to return primarily for the hotel's location, service and price. I reserved the room on their website. For 150 euros per night, it was among the most reasonable in the Marais during May (a normally prime tourism period in Paris). Upon arriving, there were no issues at checkin. My reservation was on file, the first night was pre-paid and within 5 minutes we were in the room and unpacking. We had room 46, located in the back of the hotel with a view facing the courtyard. The room was very quiet as there was only one other room that shared our floor. With a view of the courtyard, there was no noise from the street either. Never had to wait long for the elevator, which is small. Only room for two or three people. The room was small, but this does not come as a surprise. Most of the hotels in older Parisian buildings have small rooms. Sometimes it required the two of us to reshuffle luggage to move about, but nothing we could not handle. Definitely not a room for those who might require handicap accessible features though. Bathroom with shower (no bathtub) and hair dryer. Hot water worked flawlessly for the four nights we were there. Cable/Satellite TV with NO ENGLISH CHANNELS. If you want your daily fix of CNN, etc. you need to speak French to understand anything on TV. TV wasn't a problem since we were never in the room to watch it. Free wireless internet in the room worked perfectly. Air conditioning also worked when we used it. Metro access at Rambuteau and/or Hotel de Ville takes less than 5 minutes walk and will take you anywhere you want to go to Paris. Upon leaving for the airport, a quick 5 minute walk to Les Halles/Chatelet got us on the RER/B train and to the airport in 30 minutes, no traffic delays. In summary, a quality hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “"Cute,Nice Hotel in a great location"”
Reviews.Author: benearme8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. Our room is cute on the third floor,with 2 windows overlooking our street.Bathroom is very clean but small which we knew before we get there. One of our favorite about the hotel is location. Lots of coffee shops,pastry shops,and very close to Marais which is a lively neighborhood. Also, acrosss the Pompidou museum. All front desk person are nice and helpful, like Kais and the lady.10 to 15 min walk to the train station. We definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and will stay here again if they give us the same room. :) Mr. Del Rosario

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its finest”
Reviews.Author: LarryJHYVR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed three times at Hotel Beaubourg. It's location, service, and charm make our visits to Paris feel like we are at home. The staff is friendly and attentive. We have recommended the hotel to many of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “I will highly recommend this hotel to friends -- lovely decor, clean, friendly."”
Reviews.Author: JaneHelene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed everything about this delightful, reasonably priced, small, meticulously restored hotel. The decor is tasteful, fresh and charming, the breakfasts and breakfast room were wonderful, our room consistently spotless, and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. As is typical in the older, private European hotels, our room was small , but it was very attractive with whitewashed walls, multiple weathered beams supporting the ceiling, as well as beautiful fabric covering the walls and coordinated linens. The staff was tolerant and appreciative of my poor French but when needed, just helped me out in English. Loved the location in the Marais -- across the street from the Centre Pompidou and all kinds of small, excellent restaurants nearby. Walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Orangerie, Musee D'Orsay, Opera, etc., etc. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value in the heart of the Marais”
Reviews.Author: wetravellight11
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the Marais down a very small alleyway across from the Pompidiou Center. Although moderately priced, the rooms are tastefully done in traditional French toiles and both the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Although our king-sized bed was comfortable it was very firm. Our ground floor room overlooked a courtyard that was in full bloom in early May and smelled great. If you prefer more security, ask for a room on an upper floor. The air conditioning was great as it was unusually warm for May. Front desk staff was very helpful and spoke enough English for us to communicate effectively. Room includes a mini-fridge and flat screen TV. Only 1 English channel but when in Paris who needs to watch TV? Their continental breakfast for 9 euros was massive and delicious, but most mornings we just chose a quick coffee and croissant at a local cafe. Very close to tons of eateries, grocery stores, and boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTocino
Reviews.Content: This is my sixth visit to the Hotel Beaubourg, and it continues to be reliably good. The rooms are well-appointed (small, but with all necessary ameneties) and the public areas are nice The staff is very helpful. My only past complaint about the Beaubourg was the lack of wi-fi in the rooms. YOu used to have to use your lap top in the library. That has now changed and there is consistent wi-fi service throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RFoster_11
Reviews.Content: There's no better place to stay in Paris than the Marais. Centrally located just a couple of blocks from the metro (11, Rambuteau), a short walk from Notre Dame, and just a stroll to countless cafés, boulangeries and boutiques, the Hotel Beaubourg was the perfect home-base for our jaunts through the city. The accommodations were more than comfortable. Room 32 had 2 comfy twins pushed together (no complaints about length from someone who is 6ft tall) with night tables, a little fridge, a bath with a shower, a closet with shelves, a desk and a television. The maintenance staff kept everything impeccably clean each day. The concierges were so very warm and helpful that I hope to see them again soon! Merci beaucoup! À bientôt!

Reviews.Title: “Homelike”
Reviews.Author: ars2011
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Clean, good location. Very friendly personnel. The Boss is Madam. She is very kind and helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with view of the Pompidou”
Reviews.Author: hellcat_101
Reviews.Content: Service was really friendly and staff were really helpful. The room (42) was beautiful with cute little windows that you could see the Pompidou centre from when you leaned out!!! There was no room safe which was a bit inconvenient, but the hotel is close to Metro and RER stations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet, comfortable and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kathysong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in April...it is practically across the street from the Pompideau Center and on the edge of the Marais area. The concierge was quite pleasant and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. The bathroom was large and rather modern for a Paris hotel. Its off-the-main-street location makes it a quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, having spent much time looking over reviews on Tripadvisor. I finally picked this hotel for its location - literally across the road from Centre Pompidou - I was arriving in Paris at Gare Du Nord and it wasn't far from the station and it also appeared to be in close (walking) proximity to major sights and must-dos. This was a good choice given the traffic chaos in central Paris on the afternoon of my arrival. I managed to get a slighter better room rate through Expedia than via the hotel itself. I was surprised at the size of my room, larger than what I had expected and it was very comfortable. It was away from the street , overlooking a central courtyard and was very quiet. A fairly average breakfast was available in a refurbished basement area, although on my first morning hotel staff were running late and nothing was available at the advertised breaklfast time. My only concern would be the manner of the front desk staff. Despite my attempts at basic French (and English was spoken here), I felt on several occasions that I was imposing upon their time. One evening the person on reception was on the phone and continued with her conversation while I waited and waited. I am not sure if I would stay here again as it turned out that most of the major sights I was interested in were located on the Left Bank. However the hotel was a comfortable base from which to explore Paris. There are plenty of restaurants around Centre Pompidou for evening meal choices. It is also close to the Marais area which was great for shopping and general 'people watching'.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: panda65
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, about 5 minutes from the river and Notre Damme. A bit tired and not good value at 145 euros a night. Room was clean and away from traffic but lift and other guests created some noise. Good breakfast in the cellar for extra 9.50 euros. Overall, OK bearing in mind the cost of hotels in Paris, but we found the hotel a bit claustrophobic and staff were generally indifferent and we didn't come away with any sense of enjoyment from our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel - assaulted by hotel manager!”
Reviews.Author: Jackson123_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel. The location was good, but that was the extent of it. The rooms are nothing like they are shown on the website. Despite booking a kingsize room, it was so small that there was not even room to put our suitcase down. When I complained to the hotel manager, he proceeded to shout in my face. He became so agressive that I almost called the police. When I stayed there, I saw a number of other guests complaining about their accommodation and all of them received the same response - shouting - completely unprofessional and unwelcoming. I would not recommend this hotel. There are so many lovely hotels in that area that are more reasonably priced and that are run by people who want to welcome their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: le-pecheur-Villepot
Reviews.Content: Paris does not come cheap, but this hotel does provide affordable accommodation in an convenient part of the city. Within 100 metres of the Pompidou Centre, a ten minute walk from Notre Dame, a fifteen minute stroll to the Louvre, Metro stations close by and a reasonable selection of eating places just a few minutes walk. The hotel does not provide a restaurant - apart from breakfast. We did not have a car with us and there is no parking at the hotel, but there are car parks nearby, although I have no idea of cost. the Metro is so good and cheap that I would always avoid taking a car into the city if at all possible. Tucked away in a narrow side street, initial concerns about traffic noise proved unfounded. Our room (No 4) was very quiet and offered a king-size bed, a good size bathroom - a bath with over-shower - ample storage for clothes, satellite TV, but sadly no tea/coffee facilities. The towel rail situated VERY close to the lavatory got extremely hot - a possible risk of burning while seated upon the throne! Breakfast, which was a slightly above average 'continental', is taken in interestingly refurbished cellar. Some cooked breakfast items are available as well if required. At busy times there may be a wait for a table. Breakfast service is from 7 to 11am. Wifi is operating throughout the hotel and a computer is available for the use of guests without charge -a nice touch that. The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and information and at least two spoke good English. The reception desk is manned 24 hours. Checkout is at 12 noon but there is a baggage room to leave cases if departure from the city is later in the day. We will certainly return to Hotel Beaubourg on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected; excellent location in the Marais close to RER transit!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: Just know before I continue that I'm pretty picky about my hotels, I live in NYC/Manhattan, and have traveled the world on business and for pleasure and typically stay in 4 star / 5 star hotels. I know a dump from a palace and this hotel was certainly way better in person than any of the photos I've seen, and while certainly not a palace this lovely small boutique hotel was comfortable, QUIET, CLEAN, and everything I needed for a quick 24 hours in Paris. I've stayed all over Paris, and while this wasn't the Ritz it certainly lived up to its appeal as a charming, small boutique with larger than average rooms, great front desk customer service, and amazing central location in the Marais. I was in Paris for 24 hours and spent a night here as I wanted good access to the Marais AND Les Halles Metro so I could get back and forth to Charles de Gaulle Airport easily. Hotel is right next to the Pompidou Center (known as locals as Beaubourg), and about 5-7 minute easy straight-shot walk from hotel to Les Halles metro stop for the RER and other transpo options. I paid $210 for the night for a standard room. Hotel lobby is small, cute, but nothing fancy. I'm more used to chain hotels (think Sheraton, Westin, etc) and didn't come here for business so didn't need all those amenities. I've stayed at the Westin Paris at Place Vendome which was amazing - didn't want to spend on all the glitz this time. Just a quick 24 hour trip to Paris en route to Italy. Reception was always very nice - had to return the key each time upon entering and leaving hotel which I really hate. But it's common in Europe. More a safety concern which is why I think they ask you to leave your key when you leave the hotel. Teeny tiny elevator but enough for me and my bags. Room itself was on the top floor and was really cute. Bigger than I expected, and had a large bathroom, King bed (two twins pushed together which is typical in Europe) a writing desk, fridge, closet, and a little sofa. Cute view over the rooftops/courtyard. Bathroom was CLEAN. Room was CLEAN. While this hotel could certainly use an upgrade, and it would be a lovely boutique, the furnishings were somewhat simple/plain/dated. Though I cannot stress again how clean everything was. No gross spots, marks, stains, dust, cobwebs. So you don't have high end luxury furnishings but you have a good clean comfortable and rather spacious (for Paris) place to lay your head. My biggest grip (and always is in Paris/Europe) was the shower. This shower had the half-size glass shower 'curtain' that only covered half the length of the tub, so of course I got water everywhere. BUT at least there were plenty of good (and shockingly comfortable) towels to wipe up the water. :-) If you're here with your partner, husband, wife whatever this is an excellent cheaper option for a pleasant stay in a cute boutique hotel in the middle of the Marais. Again not the Ritz, but there was nothing lacking in my stay. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel in the centre of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Rampantlad
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this location, at the end of the street from the Pompidou Centre, in the heart of the Marais, only a short walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower. Friendly staff, excellent prices, cute roooms which are reasonably spacious for central Paris and ours had stable-like wooden beams.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: stfn100
Reviews.Content: The best location in Paris for sightseeing, shopping, clubbing and close to the fashionable district of Marais. You can almost walk anywhere but this charming hotel is also well served by public transport (metro and buses). Our room was spacious (but not enormous), clean, well appointed and very quiet even if it was facing the street side. Only drawbacks: a small cupboard and no safe in the room. I will definetely stay there again next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great value stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SHANDREW
Reviews.Content: Cute, ideally located boutique style hotel - literally 5 mins walk from Chatelet les halles metro stop. Rooms are a little small however spotlessly clean and very quiet. An added bonus was the ability to open the window for some fresh air and relief from central heating. Reasoonably priced and perfect for a short stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Another average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHolidayGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 5 minutes walk from chatelet les halles - a major hub from where you can get trains to all parts of Paris. The precise location is a side road next to the Centre Georges Pompidou, which is a large museum and cultural centre which one should visit when in Paris. My room was very small, and the thing I found most frustrating was that there was only one socket in the whole room! This was frustrating as I was a business traveller with two laptops and two mobile phones that all needed charging. There was no bath in the bathroom, just a power shower. The hotel had a cosy feel, but if you're claustrophobic, then you might not want to stay here. The internet connection was of a decent quality. To sum up, I found this hotel to be an average hotel for the price I paid - nothing too special.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: PCsGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel. It was a little difficult to locate - it sits on a small sidestreet and the entrance is not very clearly marked. However, we found it to be quiet and comfortable. It is conveniently located near a Metro stop and not far from the Seine. Overall, a pleasant little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight”
Reviews.Author: myra327
Reviews.Content: Sweet boutique Hotel a stone's throw from the Centre Pompidou. This hotel is quiet, clean, has lovely rooms with tile bathrooms, free wi-fi and use of computer in lobby. The help are unbelievably helpful from making reservations to giving suggestions and directions. The location is close to everything in the Maris and has the advantage of being close to the Pomidou as a reference point. Close to a few Metro stops, Notre Dame and the Seine. I can't say enough about this Hotel. It's really a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for top location”
Reviews.Author: Camealongway
Reviews.Content: Husband and I visited Paris for total of five days to enjoy the food, shopping and some sights. If you're looking for a 'foodie' area, boutique shopping and easy access to great sights, you cannot beat the Marais area. Proximity to Rambuteau and Hotel De Ville metros means journeys to other areas are quick and convenient. Hotel is located in relatively quiet side street directly behind Centre Pompidou so we enjoyed reasonable level of peace and quiet. Our double room faced inner courtyard which I would recommend. However room size is tiny (typical in Paris) and bed was only of average comfort. Shower pressure and temperature were good though. Importantly for us - the room and hotel were consistently clean. We were appreciative of the front desk staff who we found to be very helpful, accommodating and spoke good English. True they may not be the most smiley or chatty people, but we took this to be 'cultural' so we didn't take it personally. We would definitely stay here again given value for money and location. Warning: we used the airport transfer service from hotel to CDG. We were advised trip would take 1 hour. However, the car was 1/2 hour late to arrive plus the trip took 1.5 hours - a 2 hour trip in total. Lucky we did not miss our flight but we felt they should either have advised us of the delay so we could make alternative arrangements or they should have skipped the second guest pick-up which resulted in about a 30 minute detour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: YYZer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg for 2 nights in late August with my husband and two daughters (in their 20s). We had two beautiful rooms that were spacious, comfortable and very clean. The location is excellent, walking distance from many attractions like Centre Pompidou, the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. The only difficulty we had was finding street parking in the evening (parking is free in August).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but the decor is overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: 8lettersuk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel a couple of times now when in Paris. It's close le Marais and great tourist spots like le pompidou. It's relatively inexpensive although our big takeaway from this hotel is the rooms all seem very floral and way too co-ordinated for our tastes with bedspreads and wallpaper and curtains that match. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for it's location and price range.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for my first visit to Paris and I was very happy with the choice. This was an easy walk from the Chatelet metro station even with a large rolling bag. Check in took all of about 60 seconds. I stayed in a large King Room on the 3rd floor that faced a courtyard. The room is dark, because of the low beamed ceilings and the dark fabric on the walls. Also the lighting seems to be low wattage as well. The King room had plenty of room plus the big bed which was a true king and not just two smaller beds pushed together. Because of the fabric on the walls, the room was very quiet. You could hear a pin drop at night. Bathroom was modern and well equipped. Also free wifi, which worked pretty well most of the time. A really nice perk. Maid service was very efficient (and friendly!) They all respected my Do not disturb sign (I usually slept really late!) AC worked fine, but most of the time just opening the window was fine. Front desk staff were friendly but did not offer a lot of suggestions for local bars and eateries etc. I tried the hotel breakfast one morning and it was fine. Also you need to leave the key at the desk when you leave every day which I loved because it was one less thing to lose. Even when I stumbled back to the hotel at the odd hour in the middle of the night there was no problem with the staff letting me in and getting the key. The location is very busy on weekends and even though there is ALOT going on in this area, did not notice any of it once I was tucked into my room. I was able to walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens and even the Eiffel Tower from here. Highly recommend this hotel for any traveler coming to see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beaubourg is a quiet, hidden treasure in a huge and bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: emwarren
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beaubourg in a quiet side street near the Pompidou Centre and just a short walk to the river and Notre Dame. There are many cafes and restaurants nearby and the bus (which also goes to Nord train station) is just around the corner. The hotel staff are very helpful and the hotel itself is charming. I took the advice of a previous tripadvisor review and asked for Room 4. It is very spacious with queen sized bed, great ensuite,lots of cupboards, a small table and two chairs. It is on the ground floor and has french doors leading to its own courtyard with outdoor table and chairs and nice little garden. Couldn't want for more. I think that the price is not too bad either for what we got compared to other Paris accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: dogbracket
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. You're bang in the middle of everything with 3 metro stations a few minutes away. Lots of excellent restaurants close by but sadly some were closed for holidays when we visited. Staff are friendly and accommodating and the rooms are spotless and as it's a very old and charming building, the rooms are quite dark. The only down side was the lack of garden. The hotel's web site promoted the garden as a feature and we were looking forward to a little green oasis. Sadly the builders were in, the garden was out of bounds, and we were disturbed by their early start on Monday morning. I would certainly go back there and hope to make use of the new garden on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great value, good location, clean and air conditioned.”
Reviews.Author: HattieOxford
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel with all of the essentials but no frills. It has free internet, air conditioning, average sized rooms with nice decor, very modern bathrooms and good service. They will provide transportation to the airport for a small fee. It is an easy walk from the train station and in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmile_10
Reviews.Content: We really appreciate the older gentleman that welcomed us the evening that we arrived. He was very helpful, kind and took great care of all guests who arrived. We liked the room (a little dark on the bottom floor but still spacious, clean and nice). The location was great and we would stay here again. All in all, a wonderful welcome to Paris. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: cashmerequeen
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Beaubourg for 10 nights in July 2010. We were traveling with another couple, and they recommended this hotel as it was mentioned in a Rick Steves guide. It did not disappoint. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very modern. It had a small fridge. It was very quiet, and the front desk staff was quite helpful. The breakfast each morning is kind of expensive--I would recommend eating elsewhere. We departed very early in the morning....and the gentleman at the front desk opened the breakfast room and made our coffee so we wouldn't have to go without. That was above and beyond. Overall a great experience. And....very close to the Rambateau metro stop (about 1/2 a block). Convenient to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay and it lived up to prior...”
Reviews.Author: KieranR
Reviews.Content: Our second stay and it lived up to prior experience. Room 12 was a bit noiser. Breakfast in the room is such a treat. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnMyToes79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, nearby Metro & funky shops! Supermarket around the corner & fantastic shopping nearby. All major attractions are within walking distance too. The hotel facilities were great (includes free wi-fi access). The rooms were very small however and did not reflect what the website says. The website says the rooms are renovated yet the room we got looked nothing like any of the room shot images on there! It was a little disappointing. If you want a basic room, small shower/bathroom then this is fine. We were only disappointed because we were expecting a room like the website portrayed. The staff were friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: jclaire_98
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Beaubourg. It is very clean, modern, and comfortable. The location is fabulous. It is across the street from the Pompideau Center (which is open until 9 PM). It is also close to wonderful shopping, great restaurants, and two jazz clubs. If you are looking for a large hotel with spacious rooms, look elsewhere. This is a small and charming hotel. The room we stayed in was not huge- but fine for us. The furnishings were beautiful. For the money we spent, we could not have been happier. The front desk staff is very helpful and responsive. They assisted us with locating tickets for an upcoming soccer (football) game.

Reviews.Title: “Lodging in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katyafox
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel within easy walking distance to Lourve, Notre Dame, and the Bobo.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: AusAdvisor123
Reviews.Content: Located right near the modern art musem it is very close to the metro and we found the room to be clean and comfortable. Nothing comes cheap in Paris but we felt this was just a little bit too expensive. Make a move to the Marais district and get lost in the streets... lovely part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to end our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Wen11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beauborg is in a great location in the Marais district. Minutes away from shops and great eateries, and so easy to get to via the Paris metro system. We loved Paris, this included staying at Hotel Beauborg. The staff were polite and courteous. They were kind enough to remind us of daylight saving when we returned to our hotel late at night. We had a room in the attic with our own private entrance. It was absolutely lovely. Very clean, and the bathroom was a good size. The only issue would be the shower height would be awkward for a tall person because of the slanted roof as we were up in the loft. Breakfast isn't included, but that wasn't a problem as there are numerous bakeries and cafes nearby. We really enjoyed our stay and I would definitely stay here again, if ever we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Basic tourist hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sxeight
Reviews.Content: Super location tucked away on a relatively quiet lane very close to the Pompidou Centre. Metro 1.5 blocks away. Easy access to the Marais, Les Halles, Notre Dame and the Louvre. Basic European hotel. Typically stuffy (not much ventilation) European room. AC turned off during our stay because the weather got cooler; but the room still was stuffy. Nice beds. Decent breakfast; but they charge extra for it.

Reviews.Title: “A great find and a wonderful value for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Pagosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in charming, spotlessly clean, wonderful room #4 with french doors on to a private terrace with plants, table & chairs. Fresh linens and towels every day. Our room was quiet and quite large with a brightly tiled modern bathroom, though be forewarned it has the typical glass European bathtub enclosure which only partially protects the floor from water when you use the shower. Helpful and polite staff. Great location. You can walk everywhere, and the Marais district is lively, has wonderful shops and cafes and even a terrific department store in the Hotel de Ville.
