Eat at Camile's restaurant in the area. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near Pompidou Center”
Reviews.Author: zachgam
Reviews.Content: Location: On a quiet street neat the Pompidou Center. A short stroll to the heart of the Marais. Hotel: Decent size room. Large bathroom but water gets all over floor. Room decor dated and dark. It was 70 degree but when we asked about the air conditioning they said air is off because it was winter on September 29!! Staff: Front desk staff courteous but aloof, chamber maids helpful and friendly. Breakfast: We did not eat breakfast in the cellar but chose to get breakfast from the many bakeries in the area. Marais: Great location to be in in Paris. We particularly liked the restaurant in St Catherine's Square and neighborhood. All in all hotel was just okay but we were in PARIS.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: simonuineill
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here as our usual hotel was fully booked - but now I think we might stay here instead. From the first the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely - and though we were very late down to breakfast, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We chose a kingsize room and had the unexpected bonus of a nice outside terrace space (if you want the same ask for Chambre 4).

Reviews.Title: “gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ECKM
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beaubourg is a gem of a hotel situated very close to the Centre Pompidou. Our room (35) was fantastic: spacious, clean, very large bathroom and air conditioned. Dated a bit, but in superb condition. No complaints at all. Fantastic ! We have been to Paris many times, and will definately make this our hotel of choice for future trips back to Paris. The staff at the front desk were very nice and accomodating. Location was perfect. Walk to the Marais, Les Halles, Ile Saint Louis, basically anywhere. Metro stops are close by. Overall, very positive experience. We highly recommend this hotel. Note: We booked online as other people had suggested and payed a reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Beaubourg”
Reviews.Author: icetsarina52
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in good area. Close to Pompidou Centre, Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. Metro access also very close and convenient. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed, we had a room that overlooked a little courtyard area which was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Quiet. Very clean”
Reviews.Author: aebly
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Would definitely go back. Very clean room. Huge bathroom. Very quiet. Awesome location. Half block from Pompidou. We thought staff was friendly and helpful. He arrived early and we got into our room before the normal check in.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Percivas
Reviews.Content: A small, friendly hotel in the heart of Paris. For the location, the price was very good. The rooms are small by North American standards, but by European standards they were very average-sized. Our room (11) was quaint, cute and impeccably clean. We had heard the French can be rude, but the staff here were very friendly and helpful even with our broken French. The service was great, and we loved our continental breakfast of fresh breads, juices and yogurts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can put up with some of the extremely rude staff”
Reviews.Author: bluepokadots
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location in a quiet street, while being really close to loads of places to eat and drink, and several metro lines. Our room was clean although we didn't seem to be able to control the air conditioning, resulting the room bring a bit stuffy. I wouldn't go back to this hotel however, as some of the staff were extremely rude. The cleaner on her morning round completely dis-regarded the 'do not disturb' sign on our door and barged in without even knocking!! Added to this is woman on reception was just downright rude, we did try and communicate in French during our stay, but the day we left and settled our bill she didn't as much as give us a 'thankyou or good-bye' (in French or English) infact she couldn't even raise a smile. I've never walked out of a hotel without the person on reception saying goodbye especially when you've just handed over a few hundred pounds! If there was a change of staff it would be a lovely place to stay, but I wouldn't go back until that happened.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL BOUTIQUE HOTEL-GREAT LOCATION TOO”
Reviews.Author: RussellsCupertino_CA
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming, quiet, and quality yet value priced inn which has one of the best locations in Paris - this is it! It's on a quiet side street so no traffic noise. The building is virtually soundproof as it's original structure is 500 yrs old. There are many cafes and markets within one block, as well as Metro stations. Every staff member was friendly and very helpful. We were able to check in early which was a great relief to us after the overnight flight. We loved the easy access to the Left Bank, 10 minute maximum walk. It may take longer because you'll enjoy all of the people watching and views, including the plaza at the Hotel de Ville. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on the way to the Seychelles and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Clean and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: lbischof
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at this hotel- April 2009. Thanks to Trip Advisor participants, we were not disappointed. We stayed in room 22, which overlooks a small side street at the front of the hotel. The room itself was a good size considering most hotel rooms in Paris can be quite small. The private bathroom was newly finished and immaculate! The only downside to rm. 22 is that it can be rather noisy from the street. If you are a light sleeper, request a room in the back of the hotel. Breakfast is offered at 9 euros per person. This included fresh breads, yogurt, butter/jam and coffee. We added cheese for an extra 3 euros per person. We had breakfast the first morning at the hotel and although it was very nice, we went by the suggestion of other reviewers and ate at the local cafes within walking distance for the remainder of our stay. This proved to be more cost affective and fun! The location of this hotel is AMAZING! It's in the Marais section of Paris, which, is basically the heart of where everything is and walking distance to the major sites. There are 3 metro stops in close proximity. Chatalet, Rambuteau, Hotel De Ville. Also, we found ourselves going back to our hotel area to eat dinner because there are so many great Brasseries, which offer great food, casual dress, and very fair prices for super quality. Everything is open late and we found a nice mixture of tourists and locals. People in general are very nice and helpful. TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM CDG USING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: We arrived using the RER Rail line from the airport. Follow signs in the airport reading "GARE" and/or "RER." Depending on where you are in the airport, you may have to take a mini bus to the other terminal where the GARE is located. Have 9 Euros in change ready so you can purchase a train ticket from the machine, rather than stand in long lines to purchase. You will want to take the B3 RER line to Chatelet Les Halles. Get off on Chatelet Les Halles and the hotel is a 4 min. walk through some wonderful little streets. I mapped out walking directions using www.mappy.fr. This is a great website similar to our mapquest.com. Please note: If you use public transportation back to the aiport, ONLY TAKE THE B3 line. If you take the other line, you will end up in the suburbs of Paris and not at the airport. TRANSPORTATION USING AIRPORT SHUTTLE: On our way back to the airport, we asked concierge to hook us up with a shuttle bus. The cost is about 20 Euros per person and we found this to be worth the extra money as the shuttle drops you off directly to your terminal. Plan to leave a few hours earlier since the bus does pick up other folks from other hotels and Paris traffic is comparable to some of the heaviest traffic spots in the US. Pay in cash. I'm not sure if the shuttles take credit cards. Overall, the hotel is very clean and we found the service to be very good. Everyone speaks english, but it is well received when you attempt some basic french phrases out of respect. We will stay here again should we be so lucky to visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of charm for a good price”
Reviews.Author: S_and_Bs_Mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg in June 2006 and was very happy there. The staff were really pleasant and helpful; its location was really convenient; and the hotel itself is really charming. It was a great value in a fun arrondissement. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: bernardharte
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the best thing about this hotel is its proximity - in a quiet side street - to both the Marais and Pompidou Centre. It's a few minutes walk to Rambuteau Métro station. We had the very dark Room 1 on the ground floor behind reception. The supposedly King bed was more like a Queen made from two singles joined together. The décor was typically French - matching print fabric on walls and curtains - but nothing to write home about. The bathroom was pretty large with good water pressure, although the shower overwhelmed the inadequate screen over the bath. I didn't sleep well. I don't think this was to do with the bed - which was comfortable enough and on the firm side - but with noise outside and above which was never constant, but sufficient to wake me. Next time I would ask for a room on a higher floor. Breakfast which was served in the cellar from 8am - 11am was at €9/person reasonable value for the usual continental selection of coffee/juice/bread/croissant/yoghourt. It was also available at no extra charge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Marais in Paris. It's close to several metro stations (Hotel De Ville is an interchange). It's located on a quiet street, but only 30 seconds walk to the main road and 3 minutes walk to the supermarket. It's next to the Pompidou Centre, and 10 minutes walk from Notre Dame. It's also close to many nice restaurants. The hotel room is very nicely decorated, clean, but incredibly small. The bed took up 50% of the space of the entire room. There is not much facility at this hotel other than nicely decorated rooms. There is wifi in the lobby. Overall it's a good hotel in its price range.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again (Despite a few things)”
Reviews.Author: Roddy_Rod
Reviews.Content: GREAT: I loved the location of this hotel, it was centrally located right in the center of Paris and it is very close to 3 different metro stations (Chatalet, Hotel de Ville and Rambateu). You can virtually get on almost any line from those stops which is great for sightseeing. Additionally, you can take the RER B train from Paris CDG and ORLY right into Chatalet Les Halles and walk to the hotel - its only about 5 minutes and is a straight shot. The hotel is small, but the rooms are decent size for Paris and the bathroom was very large for Paris standards. In addition there are tons of things open and going on around the hotel at all times, but it remains quiet inside. GOOD: Our rooms were clean and comfortable and really that is all the maters. They were also quiet and we really couldn't hear our neighbors. There are only 4 floors and 4 rooms per floor, keeps things simple. The room also had a mini fridge - which was nice to put water and other things in there. DISLIKED: The hotel advertised free wi-fi internet access and while it was free, it was only in the lobby which was a pain to always have to go down tot he lobby to use the internet, but it also gives a social outlet by meeting others in the lobby doing the same thing and since this hotel is in the Marais, the majority of the clientele when I was there, were of the same mind-set. Lastly, they also provide a safe, but it is with the front desk and not your room. COULD HAVE DONE WITHOUT: Honestly, everything was good, the one thing I could have done without was the attitude of a specific front desk person. I was told he was the son of the owners - otherwise the rest of the staff were great and helpful. The son just has a chip on his shoulder, so ignore it and don't take it personally.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Location And The Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacknoc
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Excellent location. Friendly staff. Great price. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. So many dining options in the area. Proximity to Pompidou Centre etc so great!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Paris for Us!”
Reviews.Author: bioprof
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just 1/4 block from the Pompidou. Makes it easy when you’re staying by such a visible landmark, as you just head that direction. 1 block from a minor Metro station, about 5 blocks from Hotel de Ville Metro stop. Our room is nice; #4, like we had seen discussed on TA. This is the room down a few stairs, and has a little patio/garden. The patio made the room just perfect; it was airy, bright, and cheery, surrounded by a patio with green plants, a table and chairs. The room is actually pretty roomy, and the bathroom was newly tiled, new fixtures etc. 2 closets, no drawers, but bed seemed firm. As usual, too few plugs, glad I brought my power strip + extension cord! There’s wireless internet available in a little lounge by the lobby, it’s slow, but works. They have a computer available, or use your own. We didn’t eat breakfast at the hotel; but there are bakeries within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joannetAustralia
Reviews.Content: Having spent tireless hours searching on the internet for accommodation in Paris that was value for money, in a good location, clean and had nice decor, Hotel Beaubourg was it! Some may say that the rooms were a bit small but we found them suitable. We were very close to public transport and easy walking distance from many sights. I thought the room we stayed in was charming and had a very parisian feel with the decorated wall paper, wooden beams on the ceiling and lovely flower pots on the window sills. The bathroom was modern and a decent size. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed with the room”
Reviews.Author: Lordy
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, this is a nice hotel which is very reasonably priced, has lovely staff and has a very convenient location (across from George Pompidou Centre - brilliant art gallery on the top floors). I didn’t use the breakfast room but did have breakfast delivered to my room and it was lovely (tea coffee juice, croissants and chocolat du pain). The one problem I would have is my room! We had no 2 which is accessed via a corridor running past the lift and a lovely courtyard garden. When we arrived, the back of the hotel where our room was appeared to be undergoing some renovations, and the carpet was covered in plastic which was a bit off putting. The room itself was small, as expected, with lovely beams and a decent size bed. I would also say the bathroom was very big by Parisian standards. However, while in the shower one morning I noticed I could see through the cracks in the ceiling to what I assume was the space between our floor and the next. This made me think of spiders falling on my head – a personal gripe, but there you go. The room was slightly below street level and as such was very dark. It had two good sized windows but even when open I still needed the lights on just to see into my suitcase which I had left beside the windows. Also, if people were sitting at the free internet computer in the hallway they could see in, and anyone wandering in the courtyard had could look right in, which was a bit off-putting as I was getting changed after a long day’s walking and sightseeing! So the curtains remained closed most of the time making the room even darker. All in all I got a very good rate on the hotel’s website in high season, and the location – walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame and many great restaurants and bars – is second to none. I think my expectations were higher based on previous reviews and travellers photos and I was a little disappointed. Note the plastic sheeting in the hall was removed and the plumber who came to measure our bathroom did so quietly and quickly, so I wouldn’t let this put me off staying there again, although I would request a different room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the 4th arrondissement!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. It is centrally located with most of the main attractions within walking distance... e.g. Centre Pompideu, Notre Dame, The Louvre and the River Seine. Staff are very helpful when approached but generally left us alone which was refreshing. There were plenty of crepe venders in close proximity which my boyfriend loved... he had 6 in 5 days! During the winter months there is an ice skating rink outside the town hall which is also close by. Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but not the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: keylimejet
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Our room had wood beam ceilings and blue and yellow toile on the walls - very French and quaint. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was modern and clean. There was free internet access in the lobby, and the front desk people were pleasant and helpful. There is a lift, and A/C, both of which were quite welcome by this point of our trip! Really, we liked everything about the hotel except the neighborhood. The streets and sidewalks were literally covered with trash - a lot of it. We walked all over central Paris, and didn't find this anywhere else, including in the more easterly part of the Marais. It was kind of odd - maybe there was something unusual going on while we were there? We'll probably try a different neighborhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WilliamCSanFran
Reviews.Content: What a perfect and perfectly inexpensive place to stay in Paris. The hotel is small, but attractive and well-maintained on a very quiet alley-like street across from the Pompidu Center. The place has character and lies on the border between the Marais (old, beautiful buildings, artsy shops, gay bars, great resaurants, Jewish quarter) and the Beaubourg (hip, young, trendy, amazing food from all over the world). It's about a ten minute stroll from the Notre Dame and the wonderful neighborhood that surrounds it. The staff were helpful, kind, professional and very patient with our stuttering French. When we couldn't locate a street on our sad excuse for a map, the desk clerk drew us one, including landmarks, directing us to precisely where we wanted to go. The bed was a "real" queen size (not two twins pushed together) and very comfortable. The room had a window looking out onto a pretty courtyard. We don't bring a computer or watch television while travelling, so it not being tech-evolved (as some have mentioned in other reviews) was no bother at all to us. We most certainly plan to return to this quiet, quaint and perfectly located little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great king size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Were booking the king-size room, so can comment on it only: ir was room 02, located somehow in basement, but well worth it: the small windows were on the garden, room freshly renovated and large for Parisian standards. Reception small but pleasant, presonell friendly and English speaking. The location is very central, next to Centre Goeorges Pompidou, plenty of options also for the breakfast around (did not try the hotels continental offer for EUR 9,-). Good choce in Paris (if you can get one of few king-size rooms :) )

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: garrad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beaubourg is a great little hotel in a great location. The rooms are quiet and we had a slightly larger double room. We noticed from looking in another room that there are two sizes of double rooms. The bathrooms have a great amount of space. We were actually surprised by the good amount of space in the rooms, given that Paris isn't known for large rooms. Breakfast was substantial and it is possible to have additional items for breakfast such as eggs. I was a bit surprised that orange juice is charged separately. My only disappointment was that wifi was not available throughout the hotel, but there is free internet on a computer near the lobby. I would definitely recommend this hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, and excellant location!”
Reviews.Author: Grnwayrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Beaubourg this April. After seeing reviews of this hotel on Eurocheapo, I booked a superior room thought the hotel website several months in advance at what I felt was an excellent price. Upon arrival, we were given the key to room #4. It is on the ground floor. Having been in some really shoebox rooms in Europe, we were delighted to open the door and see we had been given a room that was quite large by Paris standards, around 12'x16', had a large batroom, and best of all, it's own private courtyard accessable by French doors. The patio is truly private, as no windows overlook it. It was very nice to come home from a long day of sightseeing and have a drink and snacks (that we purchased at the nearby convience store) on our patio! The room itself was nicely decorated, and had a minibar, flat panel television, individually controlled thermostat, and a queen bed. It does not however have an in-room safe. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean, has a nice small lobby with French and English language newspapers, a computer terminal for guests, and most of the front desk staff was nice and helpful. Be aware though, that a local call brings you a charge of 2.20 Euros! As others have said, the location is very convienent for sightseeing, about a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, maybe 15 minutes to the Louvre, and the Rambateau metro station is literally 3 minutes from the front door. We loved staying in the Marais, with it's nice variety of cafes, bistros, boutiques, and small museums. Try Patisserie LeGay Choc for wonderful croissants on Rue St. Croix de Brettonaire in the morning! Also, Cafe Trois Chinon was a great place to have a glass of beer or wine after a long day out. Would gladly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A cut-price gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancemonkey
Reviews.Content: Budget Paris hotels can really be hit and miss. I found Hotel Beaubourg on travelintelligence.com and thought it was worth a try. The booking was made through booking.com and we had no problems at all. Check in was easy and they actually allowed us to check in early at 10.30am on a Sunday morning, which was great considering it is a small hotel. As for the room, it was clean, recently (and tastefully) renovated and very large (another bonus in Paris). It had cable TV, a mini bar and a decent sized bathroom with a good shower (again, another bonus for Paris). The one downside of the room was the bed, while comfortable it was a bit soft for my liking. The hotel has a fantastic Marais location and is within three minutes walking distance to the Metro. All for 130 Euros per night, very good value. Breakfast was an additional cost, but with so many great places located within an easy walk of the hotel, we didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wineglobelovers
Reviews.Content: We arrived anticipating pretty much the same experience as we had read in the reviews - decent rooms, good location, stern woman at the front desk - we got all of those. All was good - room was clean, located in a quiet little side street, easy access to metro, quick shot to both North and East rail stations. All in all, would recommend based on price, location, and rooms. The woman at the front desk grows on you too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuleux like Paris”
Reviews.Author: chana12
Reviews.Content: İt' s not my first time at Hotel Beaubourg and more i know Paris more i grow to like this place.İt's comfortable,easy going stuff,large rooms considering the average size in paris and most importantly its a 10 meters away from centre beaubourg and all the nice coffees there. The prices are more than convenient, it is definitly a good place to start falling in love with Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ciska56
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Beaubourg. We stayed in a king size room, that had a plush double bed. Very high ceilings made the room feel big. Nice sized bath, but strange set-up for the shower causes water to go everywhere in the bathroom. Put towels on the floor before you hop in. Also the lights in the hallways and stairs turn off after a few minutes so you end up groping around in the dark for the light switch so you can find your way to your room. Room had mini-fridge and huge windows that opened into a little courtyard. There was a cafeteria downstairs but we never used it. The free internet access and computer in the lobby was a real perk. Location was great, we walked everywhere we needed to go but metro stop just across street too. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jetboy787
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Fantastic location 5 min walk to Notre Dame, on the edge of the Marais. It is only a 5 min walk from the RER at Les Halles so connecting from CDG is no problem. It is just near the Georges Pomidiou Centre and very handy for great shops bars and restaurants in the Marais. Rooms were reasonable size for Paris, nicley decorated and the bathrooms were recently removated and very clean. Staff were plesant and helpful. We will stay again at Hotel Beaubourg!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over new year, and overall I was impressed by this hotel. As I had not booked the hotel myself I was a bit wary, but my fears proved unfounded. It is in a superb location very close to the centre of the city. The rooms are on the small side, but tolerable. Some of the bathrooms seem to have been renovated and are very nice - ours hadn't and had only a shower and was a bit dated. My only complaint is the sweaty beds - not sure that waterproof mattress covers are really acceptable in hotels! In spite of this the hotel offers good value and I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravellerNS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Beaubourg for 7 nights and found it lovely. Yes, the room was small, but by no means tiny. The bathroom was large and modern and the hotel was very clean. The staff was friendly and courteous and were quick to grant any request. The property is centrally located and was a great "home base" for our first trip to Paris. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris must have better than this!”
Reviews.Author: ngman
Reviews.Content: Do not believe this hotel's website - the pictures of nicely furnished rooms with interesting and quirky furniture don't seem to exist - instead, you get a room not much bigger than the length and width of a double bed and little else. And the bed was super uncomfortable - if there was enough space on the floor, it would have been more comfortable! Paris may not be blessed with many decent hotels in this price range, but I'm sure there are others that are better. Incidentally, booking via the web incurs a minimum €5 commission charge - you're better off calling the hotel direct.

Reviews.Title: “sweaty beds - eek!”
Reviews.Author: banana98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was below average - was disappointed with the size of the room (the phrase "swing a cat" springs to mind) and the bed was tiny compared to the photos on the website. It was also a very uncomfortable bed and my boyfriend came back with a bad back. They seemed to have some sort of plastic sheeting on the bed which made me wake up in the night in a cold sweat - it was just a bit of an unpleasant experience, and given that I was on holiday, not ideal from the point of view of relaxing. On the plus side, it was a quiet room behind the courtyard (spoiled slightly by other guests shouting and screaming in the middle of the night which the hotel staff either didn't know or care about) but I think that generally, the hotel does not live up to expectations. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Beaubourg”
Reviews.Author: NancyJE
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location could not have been better. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “6th time in Paris was a HIT !”
Reviews.Author: SnakeCityGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/29-10/2/07: All staff were outgoing, friendly & helpful (except 1 weekday counter lady who had the normal Parisian reserve). Being on the edge of the Marais was different and we found it to be a great location, very handy to all the main sights of Paris. We got to more places on foot with less Metro than when staying on the Right Bank. The room was nice but we did have a hard time figuring out the AC remote control so we opened the windows at night to cool off and that was fine if a tiny bit noisy in the AM (we should have asked the staff for help w/ the AC but we didn't; if we'd stayed longer we would have). HINTS: After 6 visits spread over 25 years we heartily recommend you get an RER/Metro/Bus pass for the duration of your stay as soon as you arrive at CDG or Orly and it will save you lots of money & stress getting around. Also we traditionally take the Bateau Mouches each visti but this time we got a 2 day pass for the BatoBus and we found it to be almost as useful as the Metro pass and lots more fun going up & down the Sienne to shop & visit the sights.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: UkCarver
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but this hotel is well-located on the Marais side of the Pompidou Centre. Rooms are a reasonable size for the price and bathrooms look like they have been recently refurbished. Although not our style, some people might go for the beamed ceilings. With comfortable rooms, the prices are good for the location, size and standard (especially if you want AC). Recommended. Try Pain de Sucre on nearby Rue Rambuteau for exquisite and cutting-edge patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and impertinent staff”
Reviews.Author: Urmel66
Reviews.Content: Having booked well in advance, we were informed upon arrival that they had an IT problem and lost a few reservations - including ours. Funny enough, we have seen our confirmation eMail in the receptionist's documents, so we are absolutely sure that this was just a daft attempt to distract from the fact that the hotel was simply overbooked. They offered accomodation in another hotel, "very nice and just around the corner". As we had never heard or read anything about this other hotel ("Hotel Vieux Marais"), we insisted on inspecting it and its rooms, at first. The receptionist told us that we would have to pay the first night at Hotel Beaubourg by signing the credit card receipt issued as security deposit (Hotel Beaubourg will clear with the other hotel) and that we will only have to pay the second night in the alternative hotel. When we refused to sign the credit card receipt before having seen the hotel, the receptionist was extremely impertinant, using swearwords and tried to intimidate us. After a rough discussion, we left our luggage in Hotel Beaubourg and went off to see "Hotel Vieux Marais". What the receptionist described as "nice and clean" was a 2-star-hotel (Hotel Beaubourg has 3 stars!) with an ugly reception, run-down lift and awful rooms - all in all not worth half of the money we were asked to pay! After having returned to Hotel Beaubourg, we told the receptionist that we are not going to change from 2- to 3-star and he suddenly began calling other hotels in the area. We agreed on changing to another 3-star hotel (Hotel Bretonnerie) which we knew from our other trips to Paris and which is comparable to Hotel Beaubourg. All in all, we had a great stay at a nice hotel with friendly staff, but we will never book at Hotel Beaubourg, again! Overbooking, rude staff and an attempt to shift us off to a much cheaper hotel at the same price (and probably keeping the difference) is not a good way to attract future guests!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire22
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a clean and reasonably priced hotel in the Marais district and this hotel met all our expectations. The Beaubourg is well located behind the Centre Georges Pompidou on a short one way side street (a bit challenging to get to if driving) near a Metro station. We had requested a quiet room with a bath and shower and our room overlooked the courtyard and the (very narrow) bathroom had a small shower stall and full sized bath tub. The room was small by North American standards, but very typical of Parisian hotels in this price category. The air conditioning was quiet and efficient and very welcome in Paris in August. The room and the entire hotel were spotlessly clean and the lobby offered an English language paper on the weekend. The hotel breakfast was adequate, but we enjoyed going out to a cafe to sit outside with our coffee and pain au chocolat. The front desk staff seemed to change on a daily basis, but our check in and out and any requests were handled in an efficient manner. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT, Fabulous hotel, just great!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjlo
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, and a great way to end our trip in Europe. the location was awesome and I am so glad we stayed here. Will definitely return. Room number 7 was great, clean, cute and at a good price. LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet”
Reviews.Author: holiday_lover79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very central to everything. Rooms are nice and spacious and tastefully done. All in, just what you need for not too high a price. Little disorganised when checking in and out and someone decided to cut some tiles outside our hotel room at 9am but overall, good for a traveller on a budget who wants decent standards

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place, I will go back”
Reviews.Author: OnurWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: As someone who has had his fare share of small Paris hotels, I wasn't expecting this hotel to be as clean, well situated and comfortable as it was. My bathroom was very spacious and clean, the room had flat screen tv, a full length mirror and A/C that actually worked. All these are things most Paris hotels at this rate lack. The street is also very quiet, so I could open my windows at night and sleep. The location is great, its a simple walk to Notre Dame, The Louvre, and Le Marais. There are cute breakfast places around and you can take bus # 38 right across the street to go to St Michel or St Germain des Pres. Le Marais is gay central of Paris, so this is particularly advantageous for gay travellers, though not exclusively for them (majority of guests at the hotel when I was there were straight couples). I will go back to this hotel, and would recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: shortlette
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay - the location is excellent, and the centre pompidou certainly makes a great landmark for finding one's way. Booked our room early, so got a king double for the price of a double. It was nice to have some extra space. We were facing the street, but had no problems with noise. We found the staff helpful and happy to give recommendations for dinner. Unfortunately we had to eat early, because we were going to the Rugby, so neither restaurant was open. The menu's looked fantastic though! I'd be happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Maryios
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot next to Pompidou Centre, which means it is easy to find and within 1 min of a Metro stop. We stayed in room 25 which faced onto a courtyard and was extremely quiet. The room was big, by Paris standards, and the bathroom was great-modern shower over the bath and all very clean. The down sides of the hotel- the bed was a bit soft for my liking and there was no safe in the room. Didn't have breakfast as loads of cafes and bakeries nearby. The location is ideal as you can walk to the Louvre within 10 mins or so and, if you feel fit, all the way to the Eiffel Tower (took us around 1 hour, walking slowly). The staff are helpful and let us leave our luggage after we checked out and the hotel is easy to get to from CDG airport-just use RER Line B to Chalet and then hop on Line 14 to Rambateau (1 min from hotel). Room was 120 euro through venere and was ideal for a sightseeing holiday.
